creator: Joerg-Cyril.Hoehle@t-systems.com
text:
${variable} expansion doesn't work for the csv/xml filename in the various
listeners, I obtained files named '${logdir}SimpleDataWriter.csv' in the
current directory. This applies at least to the assertion, resulttree,
aggregate and simple writer listeners.

Should variable expansion work there?
Pro: It would help me provide central directory settings inside a single "user
variables" element, so I could easily switch between various platforms (Linux,
Solaris, MS-Windows).
Pro: consistency with all other fields where expansion works.

Contra: problem with copy&paste of listener element into a tree without 
surrounding variable definition

The problem occurs because the file is initially opened before the test has
fully started, and variables are not resolved until the test has started.

By the way, the output file can be defined on the command line if required.
